body:
I'd love this being addressed. And here is a little use-case.

Dynamic UIs driven by AIServices.
I have created an agent that presents a list of "Entities" as results to the user. The list is returned in a json array and I want to include partials depending on the returned entity type to drive a dynamic UI for the end-user.
@myfear what do you think about the `{#include foo.bar _dynamic /}` syntax/API? Maybe we could find a more accurate word than `_dynamic`?

What about:

{#include dynamic=true||false /} with the default / unset = false.

> What about:
> 
> {#include dynamic=true||false /} with the default / unset = false.

Yes, it has to be disabled by default due to backward compatibility. 

But for the name we use the `_` prefix already (`_isolated`, `_ignoreFragments`, ...) in order to minimize conflict with a user-provided parameter.

So we could use `{#include foo.bar _dynamic=true /}`, or maybe something like `{#include foo.bar _dynamicLookup /}`, or even `{#include foo.bar _dynamicTemplate /}`.
In that case, I'm absolutely OK with _dynamic.

> In that case, I'm absolutely OK with _dynamic.

I'd vote for `_dynamicTemplate` because it seems to be more accurate. I'll try to prepare a PR and we'll see ;-).

issue.title: Qute: include - make it possible to supply the template id dynamically

body: Damnit, I know from the start that the syntax should have been `#{include 'foo.html'/}` ðŸ¤¦

> Damnit, I know from the start that the syntax should have been `#{include 'foo.html'/}` ðŸ¤¦

Yup, we make mistakes, we learn... but we don't want to break existing stuff ðŸ¤·
